title: Sports Direct finally gets a new auditor
text:
Mike Ashley's Sports Direct has drafted in mid-table accountant RSM to oversee its books, ending weeks of uncertainty for the FTSE 250 company.

Sports Direct has struggled to find an accountancy firm to vet it since August when Grant Thornton resigned following a chaotic market update.

The retailer is RSM's first client in the mid-cap space and with a market value of £1.7bn is significantly bigger than its normal customers.

RSM scrutinises the books of 59 companies listed on London's junior stock market AIM, and was also appointed to oversee Patisserie Valerie after the cake chain collapsed earlier this year.
